actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-144.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 100.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Lightfoot demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with amendments. With written report No. 101-220.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 413.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.
Mr. Vento asked unanimous consent that the House agree to Senate amendments.
On motion to agree to Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-214.

official_title: To expand the boundaries of the Fredericksburg-Spotsylvania National Military Park near Fredericksburg, Virginia.
short_title: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park Expansion Act of 1989

summary.text: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park Expansion Act of 1989 - Expands the boundaries of the Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park in Virginia to comprise specified lands. Requires the Secretary of the Interior to take appropriate action to interpret the battles of Fredericksburg, Chancellorsville, Spotsylvania Courthouse, and the Wilderness in the context of the Civil War and American history, including the causes and consequences of such war and its effects on the American people, especially the American South. Authorizes appropriations.
